episodes.title: The Boy Who Wrote Backwards
episodes.fact: Leonardo enjoyed seeing things differently by practicing mirror-reversed writing.
episodes.quote: When you see the world differently, new ideas appear.
episodes.story: By writing backwards, he learns that familiar things can look new, opening the door to creative thinking.
episodes.coach_line: Seeing differently is where creativity begins.
episodes.daily_mission: Try taking a different route home today. Talk about what looked new.

episodes.title: Little Wings in the Forest
episodes.fact: He spent long hours observing birds flapping their wings in the forest and dreamed of flying.
episodes.quote: One day, I want to fly too.
episodes.story: By observing nature, he grows his imagination and questions about flight.
episodes.coach_line: When you look closely at nature, ideas grow.
episodes.daily_mission: Watch a bird flying in the sky for one minute and share what you noticed.

episodes.title: The Curious Apprentice
episodes.fact: At Verrocchio’s workshop, he constantly asked questions about tools and machines.
episodes.quote: Why does this move like that?
episodes.story: He discovers new possibilities by examining the structure and function of small tools.
episodes.coach_line: If you look closely at small things, they can inspire big ideas.
episodes.daily_mission: Observe one object at home and write down something you would like to improve.

episodes.title: The Eye of Anatomy
episodes.fact: He dissected chickens and animals to record bones and muscles.
episodes.quote: There is order beneath the surface.
episodes.story: By overcoming fear, he learns to draw based on what lies beneath.
episodes.coach_line: Don’t just look at the outside—imagine what’s inside.
episodes.daily_mission: Cut a fruit in half and draw what you see inside.

qa_seed: What did Leonardo see differently today?
What choice would you have made?
What do you need for today’s mission?
